SEARCH
Package Models

Class MedicationInventoryManager

java.lang.Object
Models.MedicationInventoryManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
MedicationInventoryInterface
public class MedicationInventoryManager extends Object implements MedicationInventoryInterface
Manages the inventory of medications and handles replenishment requests. This class supports the initialization of inventory data from CSV files, adding/removing/updating medication records, prescribing medication, and submitting/reviewing replenishment requests.

The class uses an internal `ReplenishRequest` class for managing replenishment requests, and relies on a CSV file handler utility (`CSVHandler`) for data persistence.

Since:
2024-11-21
Version:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize(String medicationCsvPath, String requestsCsvPath)
      Initializes the medication inventory manager with the specified CSV file paths. This method loads medication data and replenish requests from the given files.
      Parameters:
      medicationCsvPath - Path to the CSV file containing medication inventory data.
      requestsCsvPath - Path to the CSV file containing replenish requests data.

    • viewMedicationInventory

      public static void viewMedicationInventory()
      Displays the current medication inventory to the console.

    • addMedication

      public static void addMedication(String medicineName, int initialStock, int lowStockAlert)
      Adds a new medication to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      medicineName - The name of the medication.
      initialStock - The initial stock level of the medication.
      lowStockAlert - The low stock threshold for the medication.

    • removeMedication

      public static void removeMedication(String medicineName)
      Removes a medication from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      medicineName - The name of the medication to remove.

    • updateMedication

      public static void updateMedication(String medicineName, Integer newStock, Integer newLowStockAlert)
      Updates the stock or low stock alert level for a medication.
      Parameters:
      medicineName - The name of the medication to update.
      newStock - The new stock quantity. If null, the stock is not updated.
      newLowStockAlert - The new low stock alert level. If null, the level is not updated.

    • prescribeMedication

      public static boolean prescribeMedication(String medicationName, int quantity)
      Prescribes a specified quantity of a medication.
      Parameters:
      medicationName - The name of the medication to prescribe.
      quantity - The quantity of the medication to prescribe.
      Returns:
      True if the medication was successfully prescribed, false otherwise.

    • submitReplenishRequest

      public static void submitReplenishRequest(String medicationName, int quantity)
      Submits a replenishment request for a medication.
      Parameters:
      medicationName - The name of the medication to request replenishment for.
      quantity - The quantity to be replenished.

    • displayReplenishRequests

      public static void displayReplenishRequests()
      Displays the list of current replenishment requests. This method prints out the list of all replenish requests stored in the replenishRequests list. For each request, the following information is displayed:
      • Medicine name
      • Requested quantity
      • Status of the request (e.g., PENDING, APPROVED)
      It is synchronized to ensure thread safety when accessing the shared `replenishRequests` list.

    • approveReplenishRequests

      public static boolean approveReplenishRequests(String medicineName)
      Approves a replenishment request for a specified medication. This method searches for a replenish request associated with the provided `medicineName`. If a request is found and is in a pending state (i.e., status is not already APPROVED), the method will attempt to approve it by updating the medication's stock and the request's status. The medication's stock is replenished by the quantity specified in the request.

      If the requested medication is not found, or if the request has already been approved, the method prints an appropriate message and returns false. Otherwise, it updates the medication's stock, marks the request as approved, and saves the updated data to the corresponding files.

      Parameters:
      medicineName - The name of the medication whose replenish request needs to be approved.
      Returns:
      true if the replenish request was successfully approved and processed, false otherwise.

    • refreshData

      public static void refreshData()
      Refreshes the data by reloading the medications and replenish requests. This method is used to reload the medication and replenish request data from their respective data sources (e.g., CSV files). It only performs the reload if the class has been initialized, as indicated by the isInitialized flag. This allows for updating the local data with any changes made externally or between program runs.

    • hasReplenishRequests

      public static boolean hasReplenishRequests()
      Checks whether there are any pending replenish requests. This method checks if there are any replenishment requests in the replenishRequests list that have not yet been approved. It returns true if there are pending requests, and false if there are none. This method is useful for determining if any replenish requests need to be processed.
      Returns:
      true if there are pending replenish requests, false otherwise.
